alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Keith; Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Arthur, central Keith, northwestern Lincoln and southwestern McPherson Counties through 800 PM CDT/700 PM MDT/... At 715 PM CDT/615 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles southeast of Arthur to near Brule. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ogallala, Paxton, Brule, Keystone, Roscoe, Kingsley Dam, Flatts, Nevens, Broganville, Big Bald Hill, Bucktail Lake, Diamond Bar Lake, Bucktail and Schnick Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 82 and 106. Highway 92 between mile markers 134 and 138, and between mile markers 176 and 192. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 112 and 144. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT/midnight MDT/ for southwestern and west central Nebraska.
